Suppose, hypothetically, that today a miracle occurred, and from this day onward instead of having babies only as a result of having sex, all adult women began developing normal babies from unfertilized eggs occasionally (once or twice a year on average). Considering that overpopulation was already a problem before this miracle, and that energy and resources are limited on this planet, would this affect your position on abortion?

 Has this miracle increased development rate, or are there an incredible number of abortions (whether spontaneous or medical)? An average of 1.5 pregnancies per year would be pretty remarkable with a 9-month gestation period... (1.5 pregnancies per year would require an 8-month gestation period and no passing of unfertilized ova (not to mention instant reimpregnation) even if there are no miscarriages or abortions; uninterrupted menstrual cycles and miscarriages/abortions would require an even shorter gestation period.)
 
 Oh, right, miracle... It's not supposed to contain any semblance of sense.
